org.lwjgl.system.windows

Interface WindowProc


  • public interface WindowProc
    Instances of this class may be used as WNDPROC implementations.

    The default callback address (WindowProc.CALLBACK) requires that the window instance has a jobject reference at index 0 of the extra window bytes. That reference must point to an instance of this class. The instance can be associated with the window using WinUser.SetWindowLongPtr(long, int, long) or preferably, with WinUser.CreateWindowEx(int, java.nio.ByteBuffer, java.nio.ByteBuffer, int, int, int, int, int, long, long, long, long) using the param argument. LWJGL will intercept WinUser.WM_NCCREATE and call WinUser.SetWindowLongPtr(long, int, long) with the value that finds at lpCreateParams in the CREATESTRUCT struct. If LWJGL does not find a jobject reference, WinUser.DefWindowProc(long, int, long, long) will be called instead.

    Alternative WNDPROC function addresses and implementations may be set up using the utility methods in WindowProc.Util. The non-static version has the same requirements described above. The static version has no requirements, but is obviously less flexible. LWJGL does not use any of the alternative callback functions.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        long invoke(long hWnd,
          int msg,
          long wParam,
          long lParam)
        The application-defined function that processes messages sent to a window.
        Parameters:
        hWnd - a handle to the window
        msg - the message
        wParam - additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the msg parameter.
        lParam - additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the msg parameter.
        Returns:
        the result of the message processing. Depends on the message sent.
